abstract: A rule proposed Wednesday by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau would ban a type of origination fee that varies with the size of a home loan. The new rule could end "one of the most abusive costs levied on consumers when they buy a house," Edward Wyatt of The New York Times reports.

headline.main: Consumer Agency's New Rule Would Limit Mortgage Fees
